problem.title: The Challenge
problem.description: Every year, 15 million people worldwide suffer a stroke. Time is brain - every minute without treatment means millions of neurons lost. Current devices face limitations in navigating complex cerebral vasculature.

solution.title: Our Innovation
solution.description: Cognition Medical's advanced catheter technology enables precise navigation through the brain's intricate vascular network. Our devices are engineered for exceptional trackability and control.

technology.title: Precision Engineering
technology.description: Combining materials science from MIT with clinical insights from Harvard Medical School, we develop catheters that conform to vessel anatomy while maintaining the stiffness needed for control.

impact.title: Saving Lives
impact.description: Our technology aims to improve first-pass effect rates in mechanical thrombectomy, reducing procedure time and improving patient outcomes. Every second counts.

alexis.name: Alexis S. Turjman, PhD
alexis.bio: Alex founded Cognition Medical while completing his PhD, which focused on the study of cellular events leading to heart attack in the Laboratory of Professor Elazer R. Edelman. His expertise spans Mechanical Engineering, Materials Science and Vascular Biology.
alexis.credentials: PhD Materials Science, MIT • MS/BS Mechanical Engineering, A&M Paris

francis.name: Francis Turjman, MD, PhD
francis.bio: Dr. Turjman is the Chief of Interventional Neuroradiology and the Director of the Stroke Center at Pierre Wertheimer Hospital in Lyon, France. He has pioneered several minimally-invasive techniques and is widely recognized as a leading expert in Interventional Neuroradiology.
francis.credentials: President-elect ESMINT Congress • Professor of Medicine, University of Lyon

elad.name: Elad I. Levy, MD, MBA
elad.bio: Dr. Levy is the Chairman of Neurological Surgery and Professor of Neurosurgery and Radiology at SUNY Buffalo. He is a leader and pioneer who has guided the development of a majority of all novel neurovascular technology introduced in the past 10 years.
elad.credentials: North American PI for SWIFT PRIME • Director of Stroke Research

elazer.name: Elazer R. Edelman, MD, PhD
elazer.bio: Dr. Edelman is the Thomas D. and Virginia W. Cabot Professor of Health Sciences and Technology at MIT, Professor of Medicine at Harvard Medical School. He and his laboratory have pioneered basic findings in vascular biology and biotechnology development.

robert.name: Robert Mellen, MBA
robert.bio: Bob Mellen has over 25 years of Medical Device Industry experience. He has delivered consistent double digit growth as President of a $200M device business and added over $800M in revenue growth over 10 years of Business Development leadership.
robert.credentials: Venture Partner, Aphelion Capital • Former VP, Bard Corporate Strategy

katharine.name: Katharine Stohlman, MBA, RAC
katharine.bio: Kate Stohlman is a medical device executive with experience in clinical, regulatory, quality control and operations management. She serves as Vice President of Quality Assurance and Regulatory Affairs at Corvia Medical.
katharine.credentials: MIT Materials Science • Harvard MBA • RAPS Certification for Europe

casey.name: Casey McGlynn, JD
casey.bio: Casey McGlynn is a Partner at Wilson Sonsini Goodrich and Rosati. In 1990, he formed the Life Sciences Group at WSGR, a nationally recognized leader in the representation of startup and emerging growth companies in the life sciences field.
casey.credentials: Partner, WSGR • Founder, Life Sciences Group
